alert.note: Alert for Colville Reservation; Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau; Western Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 23 at 1:49PM PDT until July 24 at 6:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND DRY CONDITIONS MONDAY... .A cold front will approach Monday afternoon and sweep through Monday evening and night. Southwest winds will increase through the day becoming gusty Monday afternoon and evening with gusts of 25 to 35 mph. Temperatures Monday afternoon will climb into the upper 80s to low 90s with RH values in the teens to lower twenties. The cold front will bring a 10-15% chance for sprinkles Monday night. There is a 10% chance for isolated lightning strikes, mainly zone 709, eastern 708, and zone 101 Monday night. Gusty winds and dry conditions will continue on Tuesday with temperatures cooling into the mid 70s to lower 80s. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 6 PM PDT MONDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE COLVILLE RESERVATION...OKANOGAN VALLEY...WATERVILLE PLATEAU AND THE WESTERN COLUMBIA BASIN... The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 1 PM to 6 PM PDT Monday. * Affected Area: Fire Weather Zone 702 Colville Reservation, Fire Weather Zone 703 Okanogan Valley, Fire Weather Zone 706 Waterville Plateau and Fire Weather Zone 707 Western Columbia Basin. * Winds: Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. Winds will shift more to the west in the evening. * Relative Humidities: 13 to 24 percent. Relative humidity values will quickly increase after 6 PM. * Impacts: Any new and existing fires have the potential to spread rapidly.
info.instruction: Windy conditions will continue through the evening hours, however the relative humidity values will increase quickly once the cold front passes. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Colville Reservation; Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau; Western Columbia Basin
